events.title: Execution of Maximilien Robespierre
events.description: Maximilien Robespierre, a key figure of the French Revolution and leader during the Reign of Terror, was executed by guillotine, marking the end of the Terror.
events.significance: This event marked a turning point in the French Revolution, ending the most radical phase and leading to a more moderate government.

events.title: Start of World War I
events.description: Austria-Hungary declared war on Serbia, beginning the chain of events that led to the outbreak of World War I.
events.significance: The declaration ignited a global conflict that reshaped international relations and had profound impacts on the 20th century.

events.title: Peru Declares Independence
events.description: José de San Martín declared the independence of Peru from Spanish rule.
events.significance: This declaration was a key milestone in the South American wars of independence, leading to the eventual liberation of Peru.

events.title: Beginning of the construction of the Paris Métro
events.description: Work began on constructing the Paris Métro, which would become one of the most extensive and used underground transportation systems in the world.
events.significance: The Paris Métro revolutionized urban transportation and influenced metro systems worldwide.
